pull.title: Drop `src/libsecp256k1-config.h`
pull.body: Cherry-picked the first commit from #1142 and addressed a [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1142#issuecomment-1295099597).

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

verification.payload:
tree 11b8f6b0f7e24674b3bf9fc7a00db487abad689e
parent 9a8d65f07f171b07bd7a33828dce073d819fbdef
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1671101776 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1671101776 +0000

Remove dependency on `src/libsecp256k1-config.h`

This change eases the use of alternate build systems by moving
the variables in `src/libsecp256k1-config.h` to compiler macros
for each invocation, preventing duplication of these variables
for each build system.

Co-authored-by: Ali Sherief <ali@notatether.com>

events.message:

This change eases the use of alternate build systems by moving

for each invocation, preventing duplication of these variables

Co-authored-by: Ali Sherief <ali@notatether.com>

events.message: Drop no longer relevant files from `.gitignore`

events.body:
> Not sure about this `AC_DEFINE` macro
> 
> https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/9a8d65f07f171b07bd7a33828dce073d819fbdef/build-aux/m4/bitcoin_secp.m4#L23

I suggest removing it, it's unused, and also confusing because we use the `VALGRIND` macro.

Do not define unused `HAVE_VALGRIND` macro

events.body:
> I suggest removing it, it's unused, and also confusing because we use the `VALGRIND` macro.

Done.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -293,10 +293,10 @@ int128_struct)
   AC_DEFINE(USE_FORCE_WIDEMUL_INT128_STRUCT, 1, [Define this symbol to force the use of the structure for simulating (unsigned) int128 based wide multiplication])
comments.body: This newly added `AC_DEFINE` should be changed, too.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -293,10 +293,10 @@ int128_struct)
   AC_DEFINE(USE_FORCE_WIDEMUL_INT128_STRUCT, 1, [Define this symbol to force the use of the structure for simulating (unsigned) int128 based wide multiplication])

@@ -148,7 +148,7 @@ endif
 if USE_EXAMPLES
 noinst_PROGRAMS += ecdsa_example
 ecdsa_example_SOURCES = examples/ecdsa.c
-ecdsa_example_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/include
+ecdsa_example_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/include $(SECP_CONFIG_DEFINES)
comments.body: Shouldn't these be dropped for the example, because a user application shouldn't need our defines?
